doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Shanghai International Airport - A 1H25 Review Earnings resilient despite soft DFS Two major projects to introduce uncer_2025-08-31

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
A 1H25 Review: Earnings resilient despite soft DFS; Two major projects to introduce uncertainty; Stay Neutral

Shanghai International Airport (SHIA) released it 1H25 results, with NPAT reaching Rmb1.0B, up \(28\%\) Y/Y. Op- CF was robust at Rmb2.5B, more than twice the net profit amount. That said, the Duty- Free Shop (DFS) business performance was below expectations in 2Q25, with DFS revenue down \(5\%\) Y/Y, despite international traffic rising \(20\%\) Y/Y, while the upcoming renegotiation of the DFS contract serves as a potential catalyst for SHIA. We maintain our Neutral rating on SHIA due to its current business structure, which is less robust compared to pre- pandemic levels, while valuation remains higher than that of its Asian peers. Additionally, with the two major projects (SHIA's Phase IV expansion and Nantong New Airport) gradually unfolding, the introduction of new capacity may heighten competition and diminish SHIA's operational efficiency over the medium term.

- 1H25 results review: SHIA reported 1H25 revenue of Rmb6.4B, marking a \(5\%\) Y/Y increase. NPAT reached Rmb1.0B, up \(28\%\) Y/Y. Op-CF demonstrates robust cash generation capabilities. Op-CF was strong at Rmb2.5B, more than twice the net profit amount. In 1H25, Hongqiao Airport revenue was Rmb1.7B, \(\sim 27\%\) of total revenue. It achieved a net profit of Rmb195MMs, with a net profit margin (NPM) of \(11\%\) , contributing \(17\%\) to the total net profit.

- SHIA's DFS business performance was a miss in 2Q25. DFS revenue amounted to Rmb285MM in 2Q25, down \(5\%\) Y/Y and \(15\%\) Q/Q, despite international traffic rising \(20\%\) Y/Y, falling short of expectations. In 1H25, DFS spending per international passenger was Rmb28, which is below Beijing Capital Airport' figure of Rmb37 and Guangzhou Airport's Rmb32. This is counterintuitive to investor perceptions of SHIA being more commercialized.

- Upcoming renegotiation of DFS contract to serve as a catalyst. That said, SHIA's current major DFS contract is set to expire in December 2025, and the upcoming renegotiation of the DFS contract is anticipated to be a catalyst for the business. In our base-case scenario, we expect the revenue-sharing ratio to be in the range of \(20 - 25\%\) , which aligns with SHIA's existing contract and Guangzhou Airport's recent DFS contract (signed in August 2025 with CTG-Duty Free).
600009 SS, 600009 CH Price: Rmb32.32 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: Rmb35.00 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026
J.P. Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) Limited/ J.P. Morgan Broking (Hong Kong) Limited
See page 5 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

- SHIA's commitment to returning value to shareholders. SHIA announced an interim dividend of Rmb0.21, representing a 50% payout ratio. Additionally, SHIA completed its share buyback on July 21, repurchasing 8.4MM shares, which accounts for 0.34% of the company's total share capital. The buyback was executed at a price range of Rmb32.67-35.36 per share. This strategic move reflects enhancing shareholder returns.

- Update on SHIA's Pudong Phase IV: The Phase IV expansion of SHIA is currently under construction, with operations delayed until 2028. According to Shanghai City government news, in July 2025, the comprehensive construction of the Phase IV expansion project commenced. This includes the steady progress of Terminal 3 and the advancement of the international main building to the 6-meter structural level. The capex involved is substantial, and the parent company is primarily handling this project. It remains uncertain whether the listed company will participate, although SHIA management has not ruled out the possibility. Currently, Pudong Airport operates with four runways, two terminals, and one satellite terminal, designed to accommodate an annual passenger throughput of 80MM. Hongqiao Airport operates with two runways and two terminals, with designed passenger throughput of 40MM. The new Phase IV expansion will bring in an additional designed capacity of 50MM.

- Update on 'Shanghai's 3rd Airport': In mid-August, the establishment of the Shanghai-Jiangsu-Nantong New Airport Construction Investment Co., Ltd. was announced. This joint venture is formed by Shanghai Airport Group (SHIA's parentco) holding a 51% stake, and Nantong City Construction Group holding a 49% stake. In June 2024, the Shanghai Airport Group confirmed its collaboration with the Nantong Municipal Government on this project. However, the project has not yet commenced, and the capital expenditure could be substantial. It remains uncertain whether SHIA (the listco) will participate in the construction. The development of this new airport could introduce a degree of competition to the existing two SHIA airports. We believe it may be an overhang over the medium term.
Figure 1: SHIA's DFS revenue (Rmb '000)
Source: Company data.
Source: Company reports and J.P. Morgan estimates.
Table 1: SHIA 1H25 result review
Source: Company reports and J.P. Morgan estimates.

We are Neutral on SHIA: Despite its historical market favorability due to strategic location and operational efficiency, the post- COVID addition of Hongqiao Airport, with a focus on domestic traffic, may structurally impact SHIA's ROE and profitability. While SHIA maintains a solid track record in cost control and FCF generation, investor concerns about DFS contract revisions are mitigated by SHIA's strategic investment in CTG Duty- Free, indicating improved monetization capabilities and easing tensions.

Our Dec- 26 PT of Rmb35.0 is based on DCF. Our DCF valuation is based on a WACC of \(10.1\%\) (with cost of equity \(10.1\%\) , after- tax cost of debt \(3.8\%\) , target gearing \(0\%\) and beta of \(1.0x\) ). Terminal growth is \(0\%\) .

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we

expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
